title: Lecture 1 — Introduction
text:
🧾 Lecture Notes

Reproducibility means that independent people can obtain the same results given the same data and code.
Use version control (git), an environment file (e.g., environment.yml), and clear documentation.







Note



What you’ll learn today - Course structure - Tools (Quarto, Git, GitHub, R/Python) - How to submit assignments reproducibly

title: Lecture 1 — Introduction
text:
🧮 Code Example (R)

set.seed(159)
x <- rnorm(1000)
mean(x); sd(x)

[1] 0.0134715


[1] 0.9991268

title: Welcome
text:
This site hosts my lecture videos and notes for the term.
왼쪽/상단 메뉴에서 Lectures를 눌러 강의를 확인하세요.



Lecture 1 — Introduction





Built with Quarto and deployed on GitHub Pages.
Supports Markdown, LaTeX math (e.g., \(E[X]=\mu\)), and executable code blocks (R, Python).




Replace the VIDEO_ID with your YouTube video id (the part after v=) and place this in a .qmd file:


Tip: you can also use a pure Markdown link like
https://youtu.be/VIDEO_ID — most themes will auto-embed.
